definitions.definition: (of people and some animals) to move along, faster than walking, by taking quick steps in which each foot is lifted before the next foot touches the ground:
examples: [ + to infinitive ] The children had to run to keep up with their father.

definitions.definition: If you run an animal in a race, you cause it to take part:
examples: Thompson Stables are running three horses in the next race.

definitions.definition: to go quickly or in a hurry:
examples: Would you run to the post office and get me some stamps?

definitions.definition: to run fast in order to get or avoid something:
examples: I ran for the bus but it drove off.

definitions.definition: to move your legs as if running, while you stay in one place:
examples: I run on the spot to warm up before I start training.

definitions.definition: the action of running, especially for exercise:
examples: We go for/do a three-mile run every evening after work.
